intro: Calycophyllum multiflorum, commonly known as the many-flowered calycophyllum, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are typically opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Calycophyllum multiflorum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth or along stream banks.
